result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Taahira S Abdallah

records.addlTxt: Invoice # 36475 dated 10/27/2022 forwarded on  11/03/2022 for approval to supervisor in the  amount of $1,083.75 payable to Behavioral Consultants, Inc. for services provided by  Matthew Seipel, Ph.D.  on 09/28/2022, 10/05/2022, and 10/06/2022. th

Defendant Taahira S Abdallah not in court, in custody.  Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy in court for Taahira S Abdallah.  Attorney Jessica Ann Behling in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for return on doctor's report.  State and defense have received and reviewed the report.  No challenges to the report. Case is adjourned to 11-10-22 at 2:00 pm for an NGI Plea hearing Phase 1.
Plea hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
filed.
Order for Examination Under 971.16 NGI, signed and filed.

Defendant Taahira S Abdallah not in court, in custody.  Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy appeared by video for Taahira S Abdallah.  Prosecuting attorney Jessica Ann Behling in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
On behalf of the defendant, defense enters a plea of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect pursuant to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 971.16.  
Case is adjourned to 10-10-22 at 8:30 am for Return on Doctor's Report.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR 10:
Defendant Taahira S Abdallah in court with Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy.  Defendant Taahira S Abdallah in custody.  Jessica Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
 Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer K. Vines. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy in court, defendant Taahira S Abdallah not in court, in custody.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Review Hearing. Defendant not produced. Doctor's Report received and filed.  Doctor's report read by parties. Parties do not dispute the findings. Court adopts the findings and reinstates the proceedings. Case is adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing to Prelim Court.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Review hearing is rescheduled to 7-29-22 at 8:30 am.  Parties agreed upon new court date via emial.
filed.
Cover Sheet, filed.

Defendant Taahira S Abdallah in court with attorney Nicholas John Conrardy.  Defendant Taahira S Abdallah in custody.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant appeared by zoom from Mendota.  Case in court for a review hearing.  Defendant recently got to Mendota and no doctor report is available.  Case is adjourned to 8-15-22 at 8:30 am for a review hearing on defendant's committment for competency.
  This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Review hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
filed.
Order for Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency), signed and filed.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Taahira S Abdallah in court with attorney Nicholas John Conrardy.  Defendant Taahira S Abdallah in custody.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
Case in court for return on doctors report.  Both parties have received and reviewed the report.  No challenges to the report.  Court adopts the findings of the report.  Court finds the defendant is incompetent to proceed but may regain competency with treatment within the staturtory time frame.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to be transported to a institution for treatment.  Case is adjourned to 6-10-22 at 8:30 am for review hearing.
Court ordered proceedings suspended.
  Review hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; ABDALLAH REPORT

Defendant Taahira S Abdallah in court with Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy.  Defendant Taahira S Abdallah in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Taahira S Abdallah not in court, defendant in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with ALW, AAA., TSA, KSA, OR MHV.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.   If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $15,000.00 .  If alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list. Defendant must be in the house between the hours of 6 pm to 7 am.
  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Taahira S Abdallah in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Taahira S Abdallah in custody.  Mario Fiumefreddo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
